subject: Football
lead_paragraph: The Giants guaranteed that their offensive line will stay together for the foreseeable future, signing right guard Chris Snee on Wednesday to a six-year, $43.5 million contract extension. Snee, 26, will earn nearly $24 million in the first three years of the deal, the agent Tony Agnone said. The extension will keep Snee under contract with the Giants through 2014. Since beating the New England Patriots in the Super Bowl, the Giants have locked up three starters on the offensive line — Snee, left tackle David Diehl and left guard Rich Seubert. Right tackle Kareem McKenzie and center Shaun O’Hara are under contract through 2012.
